title: SNP's Nicola Sturgeon slapped down over new independence referendum bid | UK | News | Express.co.uk
text:
The right to hold a referendum on the constitution will lie with the UK Government Tom Harris 
However, her relentless demands have been shot down by a former Labour MSP, who said the SNP leader had no right to call a referendum. 
Speaking on talkRADIO , Tom Harris said: “It’s a difficult one for Theresa May, but she doesn’t have to be pushed around by Nicola Sturgeon . 
“The right to hold a referendum on the constitution will lie with the UK Government. 
“If Theresa May wants to delay it to a time of her choosing she has every legal and political right to do that.” GETTY Nicola Sturgeon is poised to launched another referendum next month, according to reports 
Mr Harris also alluded to a white paper published before the last independence referendum, which said: “if you vote No, Scotland might be taken out of the EU against its will”. 
He continued: “The whole claim about the EU referendum and Scotland being taken out against its will - these were all arguments which were made before the vote in 2014." 
“Scots aren’t stupid, we read that [white paper], we understood the warning and we voted No. Nothing has changed since then. 
“The SNP will always look for an opportunity to hold another referendum.” GETTY Scotland last rejected independence in 2014 Sturgeon's top moments
